content: koigu wristers materials pattern is written for magic loop method but can easily be converted to any circular knitting method size us#1 2 25mm 32 circular needle size us#1 2 25mm dpns approximately 100 yards of koigu or any fingering weight yarn 2 stitch markers gauge 8 sts/ inch with size #1 2 25mm needle cast on 52 stitches you want the mitts snug but not strangulating so if you need more room just increase by groups of 4 ie cast on 52 56 - 60 - 64 ect -- if you add more stitches you might need to add a couple extra row as well as thumb gusset stitches i suggest you make the 52 or 56 stitch ones with no changes to the gusset to check for fit and once you get the pattern you can play around some cast on and join in the round being careful not to twist work in k2 p2 ribbing for 30 rounds or desired length switch to stockinette and work 6 rounds at the start of the next round knit 6 stitches place a marker m1 k1 m1 place another marker - this is the thumb gusset and you ll increase 2 stitches using a make 1 every other row work rounds in stockinette stitch increasing 1 stitch after the first marker and 1 stitch before the second marker using a m1 every other row continuing in stockinette increasing 2 stitches at the gusset every other row until there are 19 stitches between the markers on the next row place the 19 thumb stitches on a stitch holder and continue working the rounds as established increasing one stitch in the first row to return to the original stitch count worked 15 rounds of stockinette before starting the ribbing work 8 row of k2 p2 ribbing bind off loosely but not too loosely i prefer the look of an all knit bind off to binding off in ribbing but it can get tight if you don t bind off loosely place the 19 thumb stitches on 2 dpns and with the third pick up and knit 5 stitches in the space where the thumb joins the hand you ll have 24 stitches move the stitches around so you have 8 on each dpn work 4 6 rounds in stockinette then work 6 rounds in k2 p2 ribbing bind off loosely again i don t bind off in ribbing i like the look of an all knit bind off better enjoy
